title: Learning Path: cook failed
ai_summary: The user is encountering a 'cook failed' error in Unreal Engine, which means the process of preparing the game assets for distribution or deployment has failed.
ai_what_you_learn: Enable 'Detailed Cook Stats' in Project Settings under Packaging to get more information on what assets are causing issues.
Check the Output Log window in Unreal Engine for specific error messages related to the failed cook process.
Ensure all required plugins are enabled and compatible with your project and target platform.
Verify that all assets used in your project are properly referenced and exist in the Content Browser (no missing or corrupted files).

steps.title: Step 1: Understand the Packaging Process
steps.description:
Understanding the overall packaging process is crucial to identifying where the 'cook failed' error might be occurring. This step provides a foundational understanding of the process.

👉 **Action:** Watch the beginning of the packaging tutorial to understand the basics of packaging and the roles of the different steps involved.
steps.action: Watch the beginning of the packaging tutorial to understand the basics of packaging and the roles of the different steps involved.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video directly addresses packaging, covering the initial steps and important considerations for a successful build.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Start at 0:00 and watch until ~3:00 for an overview of the packaging process and important settings. (3 minutes)

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Issue
steps.description:
Once you understand the packaging process, you need to diagnose the specific cause of the cook failure. The Output Log is your best friend here, but project settings can also impact the cook.

👉 **Action:** Check the Output Log for error messages related to specific assets or plugins. Also, review your project settings related to packaging (Project Settings -> Packaging).
steps.action: Check the Output Log for error messages related to specific assets or plugins. Also, review your project settings related to packaging (Project Settings -> Packaging).

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** While the whole video is beneficial, focusing on the sections covering packaging settings and potential errors is key.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Skip to ~3:00 where they likely discuss specific packaging settings and options, and what can cause failures. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 3: Apply the Fix
steps.description:
Based on the error messages in the Output Log, you'll need to apply the appropriate fix. This could involve fixing asset references, updating plugins, or adjusting project settings. While none of the provided videos directly address fixing specific cook errors, understanding dependencies and plugin management can help.

👉 **Action:** Based on the error from the Output Log, search the Unreal Engine documentation or forums for solutions specific to your error. If the error is related to a plugin, investigate the Lyra Plugin video for general concepts of plugin management.
steps.action: Based on the error from the Output Log, search the Unreal Engine documentation or forums for solutions specific to your error. If the error is related to a plugin, investigate the Lyra Plugin video for general concepts of plugin management.

content.title: Plugin-afying Lyra: Shipping a Game on the UE5 Lyra Framework | Unreal Fest 2024
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Although focusing on Lyra, this video demonstrates how plugins are managed and packaged. This is useful if the cook failure is related to a plugin.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Focus on the sections discussing plugin dependencies and packaging configurations (look for keywords like 'plugin packaging', 'dependencies'). Assume this starts around ~5:00. (5 minutes)

steps.title: Step 4: Prevent Future Issues
steps.description:
After resolving the 'cook failed' error, take steps to prevent it from happening again. This includes regularly cleaning up your project, using proper asset management techniques, and keeping your plugins up to date.

👉 **Action:** Review your project's asset organization and naming conventions. Regularly check the Output Log during development to catch potential issues early. Regularly update your plugins.
steps.action: Review your project's asset organization and naming conventions. Regularly check the Output Log during development to catch potential issues early. Regularly update your plugins.

content.title: Packaging Your Project in Unreal Engine
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Proper project setup and asset management, touched on in the introductory video, are crucial for preventing future packaging issues.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Revisit the beginning of the Packaging Your Project video (0:00-2:00) for a reminder of best practices for project setup. (2 minutes)
